title: Mother claims toddler almost became the ‘next Maddie McCann’
text:
Siobhan Prescott, and partner Simon, who confronted the maid (Picture: SWNS) A British mother has said she feared her daughter would become the ‘next Maddie McCann’ after maid appeared to try and snatch her on holiday. 
Siobhan Prescott, 25, claims she woke up to find one-year-old Harper crying hysterically and a woman dressed as a maid over his cot in their Cyprus hotel room.
Clocks go forward this Sunday, don't get caught out She says Siobhan’s partner Simon Smith, who was stood on the balcony of their room, confronted the maid who then burst into tears and left after trying to use the phone.
Siobhan’s says she reported the incident to the hotel, Cyprus police and the British consulate on February 28.
The family say they have since been told the maid was sacked from the five star King Evelthon Beach and Hotel Resort in Chloraca Bay, Cyrpus.
Siobhan was woken up by Harper’s crying (Picture: SWNS) The family have demanded an investigation is opened into the incident (Picture: SWNS) Recalling the moment, Siobhan said: ‘The only reason I woke up was because Harper screamed out, otherwise she could have been the next Maddie McCann.
‘When I opened my eyes I thought I was dreaming I was in so much shock.I started screaming and I startled her as she tried to pick Harper up.
Siobhan said hotel management said the maid was cleaning the room and picking up the baby to see if ‘she was alright’.
‘I reported it to the police, and the British consulate but no one seems to be listening,’ she added.
‘I find it shocking – you’d think after what happened to Maddie McCann they would want to get this woman off the streets. She could be very dangerous.’
They believe the incident was never fully investigated (Picture: SWNS) The King Evelthon Beach and Hotel Resort have said the maid has been sacked The mum believes that the incident is not being properly investigated because her daughter was never taken from them.
‘I am lucky to have woken up, but if I hadn’t God knows what would have happened,’ she said.
‘Harper could have easily been snatched and we would be in the exact same situation as Kate and Gerry McCann.’
According to the Mail Online, the hotel sent a statement on Monday confirming the incident had taken place.

It said: ‘I would like to inform you that the information you have does correspond to reality.’
But it retracted the statement on Tuesday and instead denied the family’s claims.
The second statement hotel said: ‘Do not correspond to reality.’
Metro.co.uk has approached the King Evelthon Beach and Hotel Resort for comment.
